org.cryptonode.jncryptor

Class TrailerInputStream

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.io.InputStream
      • org.cryptonode.jncryptor.TrailerInputStream
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Closeable, java.lang.AutoCloseable

    public class TrailerInputStream
extends java.io.InputStream
    A wrapper for an input stream that contains trailer data.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      TrailerInputStream(java.io.InputStream in, int trailerSize)
      Creates a TrailerInputStream that wraps another stream.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int available() 
      void close() 
      byte[] getTrailer()
      Returns the trailer data.
      boolean markSupported()
      The mark and reset methods are not supported in this stream.
      int read()
      Reads the next byte from the underlying InputStream.
      int read(byte[] b)
      Has the same affect as read(b, 0, b.length).
      int read(byte[] b, int off, int len)
      Reads up to len non-trailer bytes from the underlying stream into the array b, beginning at offset off.

      • Methods inherited from class java.io.InputStream

        mark, reset, skip

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • TrailerInputStream

        public TrailerInputStream(java.io.InputStream in,
                  int trailerSize)
        Creates a TrailerInputStream that wraps another stream.
        Parameters:
        in - the stream to read from
        trailerSize - the byte length of the trailer

    • Method Detail

      • read

        public int read()
         throws java.io.IOException
        Reads the next byte from the underlying InputStream. This method returns -1 when the last byte before the trailer has been read.
        Specified by:
        read in class java.io.InputStream
        Returns:
        the next non-trailer byte from the underlying stream, or -1
        Throws:
        java.io.EOFException - if the stream contains less data than the size of the trailer
        java.io.IOException - if the underlying stream throws an exception

      • read

        public int read(byte[] b)
         throws java.io.IOException
        Has the same affect as read(b, 0, b.length).
        Overrides:
        read in class java.io.InputStream
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • read

        public int read(byte[] b,
       int off,
       int len)
         throws java.io.IOException
        Reads up to len non-trailer bytes from the underlying stream into the array b, beginning at offset off.
        Overrides:
        read in class java.io.InputStream
        Parameters:
        b - the buffer into which the data is read.
        off - the start offset in array b at which the data is written.
        len - the maximum number of bytes to read.
        Returns:
        the total number of bytes read into the buffer, or -1 if there is no more data because the end of the stream has been reached.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the first byte cannot be read for any reason other than end of file, or if the input stream has been closed, or if there are insufficient bytes in the underlying stream to read the trailer, or if some other I/O error occurs.

      • available

              throws java.io.IOException
        Overrides:

      • markSupported

        public boolean markSupported()
        The mark and reset methods are not supported in this stream.
        Overrides:
        markSupported in class java.io.InputStream
        Returns:
        false

      • getTrailer

        public byte[] getTrailer()
        Returns the trailer data. The result of this method will be inaccurate unless the entire underlying stream has been read.
        Returns:
        the trailer data, or null if no bytes have been read using the read methods
